nodes.label: Design
nodes.notes: Design as an umbrella field including product, communication, interaction, spatial and strategic practices.

nodes.label: Communication Design
nodes.notes: Design of messages, media, and communication systems across print, digital and spatial channels.

nodes.label: Graphic Design
nodes.notes: Layout, composition, typography and imagery for visual communication.

nodes.label: Visual Communication
nodes.notes: Use of visual elements to convey meaning, information and persuasion.

nodes.label: Editorial Design
nodes.notes: Design of publications, magazines, books and long-form textual artefacts.

nodes.label: Information Design
nodes.notes: Design of information structures to support understanding and decision-making.

nodes.label: Data Visualization
nodes.notes: Visual representation of quantitative and qualitative data.

nodes.label: Type Design
nodes.notes: Design of letterforms, typefaces and typographic systems.

nodes.label: Motion Design
nodes.notes: Design of animated and time-based graphics for communication.

nodes.label: Packaging Design
nodes.notes: Packaging systems, materials and on-shelf communication.

nodes.label: Wayfinding Design
nodes.notes: Signage and spatial information for navigation in complex environments.

nodes.label: Infographics
nodes.notes: Narrative visual summaries of data and information.

nodes.label: Interaction Design
nodes.notes: Design of interactive systems and behaviours over time.

nodes.label: User Experience Design
nodes.notes: Holistic design of user experiences across touchpoints.

nodes.label: User Interface Design
nodes.notes: Visual and interaction layer of digital interfaces.

nodes.label: Information Architecture
nodes.notes: Organization of content and flows for usable systems.

nodes.label: Design Systems
nodes.notes: Reusable components and standards for scalable interfaces.

nodes.label: Service Design
nodes.notes: Design of services as coordinated configurations of people, artefacts and processes.

nodes.label: Service Blueprint
nodes.notes: Mapping frontstage and backstage processes for services.

nodes.label: Experience Design
nodes.notes: Design of holistic experiences including physical, digital and narrative components.

nodes.label: Exhibition Design
nodes.notes: Design of exhibitions and narrative spatial environments.

nodes.label: Game Design
nodes.notes: Design of rules, mechanics and interfaces for play experiences.

nodes.label: XR / Immersive Media Design
nodes.notes: Design of virtual, augmented and mixed reality experiences.

nodes.label: Product Design
nodes.notes: Design of physical products and artefacts.

nodes.label: Industrial Design
nodes.notes: Design of products for industrial manufacturing.

nodes.label: Materials Design
nodes.notes: Exploring and engineering materials for product applications.

nodes.label: Bio Design
nodes.notes: Design with biological processes and living materials.

nodes.label: Spatial Design
nodes.notes: Design of spaces, interiors and spatial experiences.

nodes.label: Architecture
nodes.notes: Design of built environments and structures.

nodes.label: Urban Design
nodes.notes: Design of urban form and public spaces.

nodes.label: Landscape Architecture
nodes.notes: Design of outdoor environments and ecological landscapes.

nodes.label: Critical Design
nodes.notes: Use of design to question assumptions, values and power structures.

nodes.label: Speculative Design
nodes.notes: Design of possible futures and scenarios to open debate and reflection.

nodes.label: Design Fiction
nodes.notes: Use of fictional artefacts and stories to explore alternate presents and futures.

nodes.label: Transition Design
nodes.notes: Design approaches aimed at long-term societal transitions.

nodes.label: Critical Making
nodes.notes: Material practices that combine critical thinking and hands-on making.

nodes.label: Social Design
nodes.notes: Design for social innovation, communities and public services.

nodes.label: Co-design
nodes.notes: Participatory design processes involving diverse stakeholders.

nodes.label: Participatory Design
nodes.notes: Design tradition emphasizing democratic participation and workplace democracy.

nodes.label: Strategic Design
nodes.notes: Design applied to organizational strategy, policies and complex systems.

nodes.label: Design Research
nodes.notes: Research about and through design practices, methods and knowledge production.

nodes.label: Design Methods
nodes.notes: Methodologies and tools to structure design processes.

nodes.label: Design Studies
nodes.notes: Interdisciplinary study of design as cultural, economic and political practice.

nodes.label: Research Through Design
nodes.notes: Knowledge generated through iterative making and reflection.

nodes.label: Art
nodes.notes: Umbrella node for arts practices.

nodes.label: Digital Art
nodes.notes: Artistic practices using digital tools and infrastructures.

nodes.label: New Media Art
nodes.notes: Art involving interactive, networked or time-based media.

nodes.label: Interaction Art
nodes.notes: Art that foregrounds interaction and participation as core material.

nodes.label: Sound Art
nodes.notes: Artistic practices working with sound, listening and acoustic spaces.

nodes.label: Semiotics
nodes.notes: Study of signs, sign systems and meaning-making processes.

nodes.label: Visual Semiotics
nodes.notes: Semiotic analysis of images and visual representations.

nodes.label: Media Studies
nodes.notes: Study of media technologies, industries and audiences.

nodes.label: Visual Culture Studies
nodes.notes: Critical study of visual practices in culture and everyday life.

nodes.label: Film Studies
nodes.notes: Study of film as art, industry and cultural form.

nodes.label: Game Studies
nodes.notes: Study of games and play as cultural forms.

nodes.label: Sound Studies
nodes.notes: Interdisciplinary study of sound, listening and sonic cultures.

nodes.label: Visual Studies
nodes.notes: Critical visual methodologies across disciplines.

nodes.label: Design History
nodes.notes: Historical study of design practices and institutions.

nodes.label: Linguistics
nodes.notes: Scientific study of language.

nodes.label: Rhetoric
nodes.notes: Study of persuasion and discourse.

nodes.label: Narrative Studies
nodes.notes: Study of narratives, storytelling and their structures.

nodes.label: Aesthetics
nodes.notes: Philosophical study of perception, beauty and art.

nodes.label: Philosophy of Technology
nodes.notes: Philosophical inquiry into technology, its role and implications.

nodes.label: Anthropology
nodes.notes: Study of humans, cultures and social practices.

nodes.label: Design Anthropology
nodes.notes: Hybrid field combining anthropological inquiry and design practice.

nodes.label: Ethnography
nodes.notes: Qualitative research method based on long-term observation and participation.

nodes.label: Sociology
nodes.notes: Study of societies, institutions and social relations.

nodes.label: Cultural Studies
nodes.notes: Critical study of culture, ideology and everyday practices.

nodes.label: Science and Technology Studies (STS)
nodes.notes: Interdisciplinary field on co-production of science, technology and society.

nodes.label: Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
nodes.notes: Study and design of interaction between humans and computer systems.

nodes.label: Computer-Supported Cooperative Work (CSCW)
nodes.notes: Field studying technology for collaborative and cooperative work.

nodes.label: Ubiquitous Computing
nodes.notes: Computing embedded in everyday environments and objects.

nodes.label: Tangible Interaction
nodes.notes: Interaction with digital information through physical objects and surfaces.

nodes.label: Physical Computing
nodes.notes: Use of microcontrollers, sensors and actuators for interactive artefacts.

nodes.label: Computational Design
nodes.notes: Design approaches using computation as primary medium.

nodes.label: Human Factors and Ergonomics
nodes.notes: Study of human capabilities and limitations to inform design of systems and products.

nodes.label: Innovation Studies
nodes.notes: Study of innovation processes in firms, regions and societies.

nodes.label: Management Studies
nodes.notes: Study of organizational structures, strategies and processes.

nodes.label: Marketing
nodes.notes: Study of markets, consumers and value propositions.

nodes.label: Branding
nodes.notes: Construction and management of brand identities and meanings.

nodes.label: Policy Design
nodes.notes: Application of design approaches to public policies and institutions.

edges.notes: Communication design as a core branch of design.
Graphic design within communication design.
Visual communication overlapping with communication design.
Editorial design as specialisation of graphic design.
Information design nested in communication design.
Data visualisation as specialised information design.
Type design as core specialisation in graphic design.
Motion design under communication design.
Packaging closely tied to graphic and product brand needs.
Wayfinding sits across communication and spatial design.
Infographics as narrative visualization.
Interaction design as a central design branch.
UX design under interaction design.
UI design under interaction design.
IA as structural layer under IxD.
Design systems linked to UI operations at scale.
Service design as distinct branch.
Blueprint as method in service design.
Experience design linked to interaction design.
Exhibition design as spatial/narrative experience design.
Game design under interaction design.
Immersive media design under interaction design.
Product design as a classic branch of design.
Industrial design under product design.
Material exploration in product design.
Biological processes in product contexts.
Spatial design connecting interior, architectural, exhibition design.
Critical design as attitude within design.
Speculative design as branch of critical design.
Design fiction as method within speculative design.
Transition design related to futures-focused design.
Hands-on critical practices within design.
Social design addressing social innovation and publics.
Co-design as participatory practice.
Participatory design as tradition of democratic design.
Strategic design connecting organizations and policies.
Design research as reflective layer on design practice.
Design methods as infrastructure for design research.
Design studies as theoretical field about design.
RTD under design research.
Shared interest in media, audiences and representation.
Graphic design analysed by visual culture studies.
Semiotic frameworks inform information design.
Visualization draws on statistical methods (placeholder).
Strong coupling between IxD and HCI.
Shared interest in collaborative work technologies.
Pervasive computing frames context for IxD.
Tangible interaction as subfield of IxD.
Shared prototyping tools for sensors and microcontrollers.
Parametric and generative methods used in product design.
Parametric and algorithmic design widely used in architecture.
Critical making employs prototyping tools and electronics.
Exhibition design and digital art share spatial concerns.
Immersive design overlaps with new media art.
Game design engages narrative theories and structures.
Game studies analyse practices of game design.
Sound studies inform sound art and vice versa.
Critical design draws on cultural studies and critical theory.
Philosophy of technology informs critical stances in design.
Speculative design relates to STS debates on futures and imaginaries.
Use of ethnographic methods and attention to communities.
Shared co-creation and participatory approaches.
Service design interacts with service and innovation literature.
Strategic design and management co-shape organisational change.
Branding relies on communication and visual design.
Policy design reuses service design tools and processes.
Shared spatial, material and experiential concerns.
Urban design and spatial design overlap in public space.
Landscape and transition design meet around ecology and long-term change.
Ethnographic methods widely used in design research.
STS informs reflexive and political readings of design.
Design studies uses tools from cultural studies and sociology.
Interaction art intersects with interaction design.
Interaction art under the broader art umbrella.
Digital art branch within art.
Sound art within arts.
